div.span: Shaler Area School District - Closed - COVID-19

span.span: ALL Shaler Area School District buildings, fields, and facilities will remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 academic school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. In case of a school emergency, please contact

div.span: Shaler Area has been recognized with the Best Communities for Music Education designation for the 3rd year in a row
Shaler Area primary students created rainbows and hearts to display as signs of hope
Shaler Area primary students created rainbows and hearts to display as signs of hope
Shaler Area primary students created rainbows and hearts to display as signs of hope
Shaler Area High School's AP biology students show off their matching biology T-shirts
Shaler Area High School team placed 1st in the annual STEAM Competition
Burchfield Primary students raised $750 to sponsor the care of 10 animals at Animal Friends
District staff and SASD's Thermo-Fisher Scientific liaison presented during the AIU’s Educators Corporations Partnership for STEM Learning Symposium
A team of Shaler Area High School students placed 1st in the team competition and 2nd in the individual competition of the Pittsburgh Regional Brain Bee
Senior Maddie Bartosh is recognized as a National Merit Scholarship Finalist

br.span: In order to comply with attendance regulations set forth by the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE), all students will need to submit attendance for each school day that they are participating in our Remote Learning opportunities. We ask that parents or students visit: https://support.sasd.k12.pa.us no later than 3:00 p.m. on each day. If your child is not participating in the daily remote learning activities, attendance should not be submitted.

td.span: Superintendent shares information and support to Class of 2020 in newest video message

br.span: Shaler Area Superintendent Sean Aiken shares an important message to the community and especially the Class of 2020 in the following video published April 15: https://youtu.be/AWAHpanJK6g

td.a: Shaler Area Latin students excel on National Latin Exam

br.span: Shaler Area students participated in and received recognition for their performance on the National Latin Exam, which tests their knowledge of Latin vocabulary, Roman culture, and mythology, and their translation skills. The National Latin Exam is a test given every year to students in Latin I-V.

td.a: Shaler Area receives state awards for its 2019 communications

br.span: Shaler Area is proud to be recognized with multiple awards for its 2019 communication efforts in the Pennsylvania School Public Relations Association’s 2019 Excellence in Education Communications Contest.

td.a: Shaler Area students take top awards in Japanese speech contest

br.span: Shaler Area High School students took top awards in the annual High School Japanese Speech Contest held at the University of Pittsburgh.
Due to the mandated school closure, Shaler Area School District now will be accepting online registrations for students entering Kindergarten in the fall of 2020.

td.span: Special Voting Meeting and Finance Committee Meeting scheduled for April 29

br.span: The Shaler Area Board of School Directors scheduled a Special Voting Meeting on April 29 at 6:00 pm and a Finance Meeting on April 29 at 6:15 pm. The special voting meeting will be convened for general business purposes. The meetings will be held via a remote meeting platform. Information regarding the specifics of the platform will be posted to the district website on Monday, April 27, 2020.

td.a: Shaler Area High School's preschool program is accepting registrations

br.span: Shaler Area High School's preschool program is accepting registrations for the 2020-2021 school year.
Shaler Area is now accepting applications for student workers for the summer of 2020.

td.a: The Go Bucket Initiative Needs Your Help!

br.span: The District Parent Council is reaching out to all the Shaler Area families for help to reach our goal of having Go Buckets in every classroom to keep our children safe!

td.a: Nominations are open for the Custodians are Key contest

br.span: Tennant Company, a cleaning products/services company, has opened nominations for its Custodians are Key contest, where your school custodian could win a $5,000 value grand prize in addition to $10,000 cash for your school.
Shaler Area is hiring substitute custodians for a variety of shifts!
